title: website: bugs in "Writing Web Applications"
body:
Here are some bugs I noticed while going through:
http://golang.org/doc/articles/wiki/

-The "The html/template package" section includes an import of "os"
even though the os package is not used at all in that section.

-When transitioning to "Handling non-existent pages", there is a loss of
continuity: the getTitle() definition is shown after the initial reference. This makes
it confusing if the user re-compiles/runs the program after each small step.

-The tutorial mentions several times that unhandled errors cause the server to crash,
but that is not the case. Unhandled errors do not cause the process to exit, the server
continues to function normally.

Thanks for looking!
